page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: This area to the north of Murroes contains some very rich farm land, with some fairly large forest plantations to the extreme north and south. The land use is predominantly agricultural. The ground slopes gradually upwards towards the summits of Dodd Hill and Carrot Hill, which is the highest point in the area. From this latter vantage point there is a very picturesque panoramic view of the landscape to the north and west. The nearest shopping centres are Forfar and Dundee. The small population is widely scattered, and since the local church, primary school, and organised social activities are to be found in the area to the south, the following pages contain many references to this latter area.
